cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SSW of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-north-eastward, skirting the South Carolina coast Thursday, then tracking near or over the North Carolina coast Thursday night and Friday before accelerating northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central-southern North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear to Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Savannah River, GA to the NC/VA border, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through North Carolina and into Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (>39 mph) are highly likely (96% chance) with a 68% chance of 50-kt (58 mph) winds and up to 20% chance of hurricane-force gusts. Peak winds at the port are expected Thursday night into early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–7 ft is forecast from Myrtle Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC, which includes Wilmington and the lower Cape Fear River, producing significant coastal flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated 15 inch totals possible along the coastal Carolinas, creating a high risk of flash flooding around Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and destructive waves, dangerous surf/rip currents, and a few tornadoes possible in rain bands Thursday–Friday.
